name: Bee
text: 0:1, Visible.

name: Nectar
text: 1:0, Nourish 1.
catalogText:
Nectar costs 1 mana and provides you with 1 Nourish.

This can be flexibly used for carryover, to dodge resets, or to permanently boost Bastet.

A good use of this card is to play it, then if the opponent passes, play another utility card to gain the boost and win the round.

name: Bandit
text: 1:2, create a ${52} in your opponent's hand.

name: Spy
text: 1:0, create a ${49} in your opponent's hand.
catalogText:
Imprison costs 2 mana, resets both player's points, then gives the opponent 1 point for each card in their hand.

While Imprison is weak early on, in the late game or paired with discard, it can answer your opponent's plays for very little mana.

Be careful if your opponent runs card draw in their deck, because they might end up getting more points than you're bargaining for.

name: Night Vision
text:
1:0, Tutor 2.
When played, gain Sight 3.
catalogText:
Night Vision costs 1 mana, provides you with 3 Sight immediately when play, and tutors any 2-cost card out of your deck or discard pile.

The 3 Sight makes the first 3 cards of the story visible to you, and accumulates with other Sight gain. This could let you see what your opponent is up to before committing to a round.

Tutor prioritizes deck, then discard pile, and not cards in the story.

name: Disintegrate
text: 1:1, transform the next 1-cost card in the story into a ${50}.

name: Juggle
text:
1:1.
When played, put the 3 leftmost cards in your hand on the bottom of your deck, then draw that many.
(Of the 3, your leftmost card will be closest to the top of the deck)

name: Sine
text: 2:4, Starve 4.

name: Fishing Boat
text: 2:0, Tutor 1, Tutor 1, Tutor 1.

name: Raise Dead
text: 2:2, put the top card of your discard pile on top of your deck.
catalogText:
Raise Dead costs 2 mana for 2 points, and puts the top card of your discard pile on top of your deck.

Be aware that any cards which resolve before Raise Dead in the story will be in the discard pile by the time it happens.

Use this to get back powerful cards like Oak or Bastet, or keep Bandits out of your discard pile to deny your opponent points.

name: Bastet
text:
2:1, this card retains all changes to points as it resolves.
(For example, if this card was nourished by 3, it stays a 2:4 once it is in the discard pile)
catalogText:
Imprison costs 2 mana, resets both player's points, then gives the opponent 1 point for each card in their hand.

While Imprison is weak early on, in the late game or paired with discard, it can answer your opponent's plays for very little mana.

Be careful if your opponent runs card draw in their deck, because they might end up getting more points than you're bargaining for.

name: Imprison
text: 2:0, set both players points to 0, then give your opponent 1 point for each card in their hand.
catalogText:
Imprison costs 2 mana, resets both player's points, then gives the opponent 1 point for each card in their hand.

While Imprison is weak early on, in the late game or paired with discard, it can answer your opponent's plays for very little mana.

Be careful if your opponent runs card draw in their deck, because they might end up getting more points than you're bargaining for.

name: Crypt
text:
2:2, your last card in the story transforms into the top card of your discard pile with the same cost as it.
(For example, if your last card in the story costs 3, that card transforms into whichever 3-cost card is closest to the top of your discard pile. If there are no 3-cost cards in your discard pile, nothing happens)
catalogText:
Crypt costs 2 mana for 2 points, and transforms your last card in the story (Not itself) PERMANENTLY into a copy of another card.

The card it chooses is based on that card's original cost. It chooses the topmost equally costed card from your discard pile.

Use this to change cards in your deck to the best choices for the matchup, or play cards with reduced cost that become stronger.

name: Stable
text: 3:3, remove from the game and note the top card of your discard pile. This card becomes "3:3, Add a copy of the noted card to your hand."

name: Boar
text: 3:4, discard your X leftmost cards, where X is the number of cards later in the story.

name: Paranoia
text:
3:3.
When played, gain Sight X, where X is the number of cards before this in the story.

name: Pelican
text: 4:4, remove from the game each card in your hand that costs 0 or 1. +1 for each card removed.

name: Beekeep
text: 5:5, remove from the game and note all 0-cost cards in your discard pile. This card becomes "5:5, add to your discard pile a copy of each of the noted cards."

name: Lotus
text: 5:0, Inspire 2. If this is your last card in the story, set both players points to 0.

name: Eagle
text:
6:6, Nourish 2.
When played, gain Sight 4 and transform each card in your hand into a ${4}.

name: Ecology
text:
7:0.
When played, gain 10 mana this round.

name: Horus
text:
7:7.
Costs 0 if you can see at least 3 of your opponent's cards in the story.

name: Icarus
text:
7:7.
Costs 0 if you have 5 cards in the story.

name: Enrage
text:
8:2, give each card later in the story -X, where X is its cost.
When played, give each card ealier in the story -X.
